1 /**
  2  * Emily
  3  * Copyright(c) 2012 Olivier Scherrer <pode.fr@gmail.com>
  4  * MIT Licensed
  5  */
  6 
  7 define("StateMachine", 
  8 		
  9 ["Tools"],
 10 /**
 11  * @class
 12  * Create a stateMachine
 13  */
 14 function StateMachine(Tools) {
 15 	
 16 	 /**
 17      * @param initState {String} the initial state
 18      * @param diagram {Object} the diagram that describes the state machine
 19      * @example
 20      *
 21      *      diagram = {
 22      *              "State1" : [
 23      *                      [ message1, action, nextState], // Same as the state's add function
 24      *                      [ message2, action2, nextState]
 25      *              ],
 26      *
 27      *              "State2" :
 28      *                       [ message3, action3, scope3, nextState]
 29      *                      ... and so on ....
 30      *
 31      *   }
 32      *
 33      * @return the stateMachine object
 34      */
 35 	function StateMachineConstructor($initState, $diagram) {
 36 
 37 		/**
 38 		 * The list of states
 39 		 * @private
 40 		 */
 41 		var _states = {},
 42 		
 43 		/**
 44 		 * The current state
 45 		 * @private
 46 		 */
 47 		_currentState = "";
 48 		
 49 		/**
 50 		 * Set the initialization state
 51 		 * @param {String} name the name of the init state
 52 		 * @returns {Boolean}
 53 		 */
 54 		this.init = function init(name) {
 55 				if (_states[name]) {
 56 					_currentState = name;
 57 					return true;
 58 				} else {
 59 					return false;
 60 				}
 61 		};
 62 		
 63 		/**
 64 		 * Add a new state
 65 		 * @param {String} name the name of the state
 66 		 * @returns {State} a new state
 67 		 */
 68 		this.add = function add(name) {
 69 			if (!_states[name]) {
 70 				return _states[name] = new Transition();
 71 			} else {
 72 				return false;
 73 			}
 74 
 75 		};
 76 		
 77 		/**
 78 		 * Get an existing state
 79 		 * @param {String} name the name of the state
 80 		 * @returns {State} the state
 81 		 */
 82 		this.get = function get(name) {
 83 			return _states[name];
 84 		};
 85 		
 86 		/**
 87 		 * Get the current state
 88 		 * @returns {String}
 89 		 */
 90 		this.getCurrent = function getCurrent() {
 91 			return _currentState;
 92 		};
 93 		
 94 		/**
 95 		 * Pass an event to the state machine
 96 		 * @param {String} name the name of the event
 97 		 * @returns {Boolean} true if the event exists in the current state
 98 		 */
 99 		this.event = function event(name) {
100 			var nextState;
101 			
102 			nextState = _states[_currentState].event.apply(_states[_currentState].event, Tools.toArray(arguments));
103 			// False means that there's no such event
104 			// But undefined means that the state doesn't not change
105 			if (nextState === false) {
106 				return false;
107 			} else {
108 				// There could be no next state, so the current one remains
109 				if (nextState) {
110 					// Call the exit action if any
111 					_states[_currentState].event("exit");
112 					_currentState = nextState;
113 					// Call the new state's entry action if any
114 					_states[_currentState].event("entry");
115 				} 
116 				return true;
117 			}
118 		};
119 		
120 		/**
121 		 * Initializes the StateMachine with the given diagram
122 		 */
123 		Tools.loop($diagram, function (transition, state) {
124 			var myState = this.add(state);
125 			transition.forEach(function (params){
126 				myState.add.apply(null, params);
127 			});
128 		}, this);
129 		
130 		/**
131 		 * Sets its initial state
132 		 */
133 		this.init($initState);
134 	}
135 	
136 	/**
137 	 * Each state has associated transitions
138 	 */
139 	function Transition() {
140 		
141 		/**
142 		 * The list of transitions associated to a state
143 		 * @private
144 		 */
145 		var _transitions = {};
146 		
147 		/**
148 		 * Add a new transition
149 		 * @param {String} event the event that will trigger the transition
150 		 * @param {Function} action the function that is executed
151 		 * @param {Object} scope [optional] the scope in which to execute the action
152 		 * @param {String} next [optional] the name of the state to transit to.
153 		 * @returns {Boolean} true if success, false if the transition already exists
154 		 */
155 		this.add = function add(event, action, scope, next) {
156 			
157 			var arr = [];
158 		
159 			if (_transitions[event]) {
160 				return false;
161 			}
162 			
163 			if (typeof event == "string"
164 				&& typeof action == "function") {	
165 					
166 					arr[0] = action;
167 				
168 					if (typeof scope == "object") {
169 						arr[1] = scope;
170 					} 
171 					
172 					if (typeof scope == "string") {
173 						arr[2] = scope;
174 					} 
175 					
176 					if (typeof next == "string") {
177 						arr[2] = next;
178 					}
179 				
180 					_transitions[event] = arr;
181 					return true;
182 			} 
183 				
184 			return false;	
185 		};
186 		
187 		/**
188 		 * Check if a transition can be triggered with given event
189 		 * @param {String} event the name of the event
190 		 * @returns {Boolean} true if exists
191 		 */
192 		this.has = function has(event) {
193 			return !!_transitions[event];
194 		};
195 		
196 		/**
197 		 * Execute the action associated to the given event
198 		 * @param {String} event the name of the event
199 		 * @param {params} params to pass to the action
200 		 * @returns false if error, the next state or undefined if success (that sounds weird)
201 		 */
202 		this.event = function event(event) {
203 			var _transition = _transitions[event];
204 			if (_transition) {
205 				_transition[0].apply(_transition[1], Tools.toArray(arguments).slice(1));
206 				return _transition[2];
207 			} else {
208 				return false;
209 			}
210 		};
211 	};
212 	
213 	return StateMachineConstructor;
214 	
215 });
